feed.title: Google Cloud: Config Connector
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Config Connector

entry.summary: Config Connector version 1.137.0 has been released.
entry.title: Announcement: Config Connector v1.137.0 Available

entry.summary: We are introducing new beta resources: DocumentAIProcessorVersion, EssentialContactsContact, BigQueryBigLakeTable, and BackupDRBackupPlan.
entry.title: Changed: New Beta Resources

entry.summary: New Alpha Resources (Direct Reconciler) including BigtableMaterializedView are now available.
entry.title: Changed: New Alpha Resources (Direct Reconciler)

entry.content:
New Fields:

  • BigtableMaterializedView: Added spec.sourceTableRef and spec.definition.
  • BackupDRBackupPlan: Added spec.backupConfig.retentionPeriodDays and spec.backupConfig.backupWindow.
  • MemorystoreInstance: Added support for MEMCACHE and REDIS instance types.
entry.summary: Added new fields to BigtableMaterializedView and BackupDRBackupPlan, and introduced support for MEMCACHE and REDIS instance types in MemorystoreInstance.
entry.title: Feature: New fields and instance types supported

entry.content:
Reconciliation Improvements:

  • Enabled opt-in for IAM partial policy management.
  • Enabled server-side apply for KMS resources.
  • Improved reconciliation for BigtableLogicalView by using deep reflection.
  • Improved reconciliation for FirestoreDatabase with identity pattern and export support.
  • Improved reconciliation for RunJob with export support.
  • Unified ComputeTargetTCPProxy direct API and controller.
entry.summary: Opt-in for IAM partial policy management and server-side apply for KMS resources are now enabled. Reconciliation has been enhanced for Bigtable, Firestore, and RunJob resources, with unified direct API and controller for ComputeTargetTCPProxy.
entry.title: Changed: Reconciliation Improvements

entry.content:
Bug Fixes:

  • Fixed an issue where ComputeBackendService backends were not sorted.
  • Fixed an issue where CloudFunctionsFunction runtime was not a supported value.
  • Fixed an issue with labels for BackupDRBackupPlan.
  • Fixed an issue with labels for RunJob.
  • Fixed a fuzzing issue for FirestoreField.
  • Fixed an issue with KMSCryptoKey import.
  • Fixed a flakiness issue in the MonitoringDashboard fuzzer.
  • Fixed a flakiness issue in tests.
  • Fixed an issue with bad labels in tests.
  • Fixed an issue with etag in direct reconciliation.
entry.summary: This release includes several bug fixes. Notably, we resolved an issue with sorting for ComputeBackendService backends and corrected unsupported runtime values for CloudFunctionsFunction. Additionally, label-related issues for BackupDRBackupPlan and RunJob have been addressed, along with a fuzzing issue for FirestoreField and an import problem for KMSCryptoKey.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed an issue with etag in direct reconciliation.

entry.summary: Config Connector version 1.136.1 has been released.
entry.title: Announcement: Config Connector v1.136.1 Released

entry.summary: New beta resources are available for direct reconciler, including AssetFeed, BigQueryReservationAssignment, CloudDeployDeliveryPipeline, and ComposerEnvironment.
entry.title: Changed: New Beta Resources

entry.content:
New Fields:

  • ComposerEnvironment
  • Added spec.storageConfig field.
  • Added spec.config.workloadsConfig.dagProcessor field.
  • Added spec.config.workloadsConfig.triggerer field.
  • Added spec.config.softwareConfig.webServerPluginsMode field.
  • Added spec.config.softwareConfig.cloudDataLineageIntegration field.
entry.summary: The Composer Environment resource has been updated with new fields including `spec.storageConfig`, `spec.config.workloadsConfig.dagProcessor`, `spec.config.workloadsConfig.triggerer`, `spec.config.softwareConfig.webServerPluginsMode`, and `spec.config.softwareConfig.cloudDataLineageIntegration`.
entry.title: Feature: New Fields for Composer Environment

entry.content:
Reconciliation Improvements:

  • Introduced Stateful Reconciliation for Direct Controllers. With stateful reconciliation, the direct controller stores a hash of the last successfully applied .spec in the resource's .status. This provides a lightweight, GitOps-safe record when a user has modified the desired state of the resource.
entry.summary: Stateful reconciliation is now available for direct controllers, storing a hash of the last applied spec for GitOps safety.
entry.title: Changed: Stateful Reconciliation Introduced

entry.content:
Bug Fixes:

  • Added support for checking etag in spec for alpha resources.
  • Fixed an issue where CloudIdentityMembership roles comparison would fail.
  • Fixed a bug where the wrong GVK was reported in IAM controller.
  • Fixed a bug where errors were swallowed when reading a Secret.
  • Fixed an issue with LRO endTime in mockgcp.
  • Fixed a bug in the etag mapper.
  • Fixed a bug in the mapper generator for slice and single object map.
  • Fixed a bug in the mapper generator for OneOf if the input is not proto.Message.
  • Fixed an import for refs in the same package in controllerbuilder.
entry.summary: Multiple bugs have been fixed, including issues with etag checking, role comparison, GVK reporting, secret handling, LRO endTime, and mapper generators. Support for checking etag in spec for alpha resources has also been added.
entry.title: Fixed: Bug Fixes

entry.summary: Config Connector version 1.134.1 has been released.
entry.title: Announcement: Config Connector v1.134.1 Available

entry.content:
Bug Fixes:

  • #5230: Fixed an issue that could lead to premature certificate rotation by ensuring errors are not swallowed when reading a Secret.
  • #5231: Add more verbose logging during certificate validation to assist with debugging.
entry.summary: Resolved an issue causing premature certificate rotation by preventing errors from being swallowed during Secret reading. Added more verbose logging for certificate validation to aid debugging.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed premature certificate rotation

entry.summary: The latest version of Config Connector is now available.
entry.title: Announcement: New Config Connector Version

entry.content:
Improved reconciliation by migrating the following resources from the Terraform-based or DCL-based controller to the new direct controller. These resources are migrated automatically and you no longer need to apply the opt-in annotation to enable the direct controller:

  • CloudIdentityGroup
  • CloudIdentityMembership
entry.summary: The Cloud Identity Group and Cloud Identity Membership resources have been migrated to the new direct controller. This migration is automatic and the `opt-in` annotation is no longer required.
entry.title: Changed: Cloud Identity Resources Now Use Direct Controller

entry.content:
New Fields:

  • ContainerCluster: DNS endpoint is supported in ContainerCluster.
entry.summary: The ContainerCluster now supports DNS endpoints.
entry.title: Changed: DNS Endpoint Support in ContainerCluster

entry.content:
Bug Fixes:

  • ConfigConnectorContext:
  • PR#4995: status.observedGeneration is now being set on the ConfigConnectorContext.
  • PR#4657: Added spec.managerNamespace.
  • SQLInstance:
  • PR#4838: Fixed bug in SQLInstance maintenanceVersion UPDATE operation
  • PR#4843: Set status on acquisition for SQLInstance controller
  • PR#4857: Support SQLInstance maintenanceVersion in CREATE operation
entry.summary: The latest release includes fixes for ConfigConnectorContext and SQLInstance, addressing observed generation, manager namespace, maintenance version updates, and status setting during acquisition.
entry.title: Fixed: Config Connector Updates

entry.title: Changed: New Alpha Release

entry.content:
Reconciliation Improvements

Added support for direct reconciliation to more resources, with opt-in behaviour. The API is backward compatible. The following resources now have direct reconciliation support

  • BigQueryTable
  • Use the alpha.cnrm.cloud.google.com/reconciler: direct annotation on the BigQueryTable CR object to opt-in the direct controller.
  • The direct controller also supports adding BigQueryDataPolicies directly to BigQueryTable columns within spec.schema.
entry.summary: Direct reconciliation added for BigQueryTable resources, with opt-in behavior via annotation. Supports BigQueryDataPolicies on columns.
entry.title: Changed: Reconciliation Improvements

entry.content: • PR#4808 filtered out Kubernetes labels that are invalid for Google Cloud in the ComputeForwardingRule direct controller, ensuring backward compatibility after migrating to the direct controller.
entry.summary: Kubernetes labels that are invalid for Google Cloud were filtered out in the ComputeForwardingRule direct controller.
entry.title: Fixed:

entry.content:
Reconciliation Improvements:
